articles.title: Tesla's Elon Musk Wants to Adopt Apple's AirPlay for Improved Sound System in Vehicles
articles.author: Sophie Webster
articles.excerpt: Since Tesla vehicles have Wi-Fi capability, it is possible for Apple AirPlay to be used.
articles.summary: Sophie Webster, Tech Times 31 May 2022, 12:05 pm (Photo : Unsplash/David von Diemar) Tesla Tesla CEO and billionaire Elon Musk confirmed that the car company is currently considering adopting Apple's AirPlay protocol to help improve the audio quality of the vehicles over its current Bluetooth connection.  Tesla to Adopt Apple's AirPlay According to Electrek, Tesla's recent vehicles have been received well by critics and customers, especially the Model 3 and Model S. The positive reviews over its sound quality are all thanks to the audio engineers from Bang & Olufsen and other audio manufacturing companies.

articles.title: Tesla Could Adopt Apple's AirPlay To Improve In-Car Audio
articles.author: Sahil Gupta
articles.excerpt: Tesla could be exploring the adoption of the Apple AirPlay protocol for lossless audio in its vehicles
articles.summary: By  Sahil Gupta | Updated: 01-Jun-22 09:37 AM IST 0  Views View Photos Musk is contemplating the addition of AirPlay in Tesla cars Highlights Tesla has been reticent towards Apple CarPlay AirPlay enables lossless audio via Wi-Fi Elon Musk said he will discuss it with the audio team Tesla has often bashed Apple with Elon Musk claiming that the Cupertino-based tech giant is a graveyard of ex-Tesla engineers. Tesla has also famously not adopted Apple's phone streaming technology called CarPlay, but Elon Musk could be warming up to the idea of Apple's Airplay audio streaming technology which works over Wi-Fi for gadgets like the Apple TV and HomePod.

articles.title: Tesla cars could get Apple's AirPlay to improve audio quality
articles.author: Meghana Kandra
articles.excerpt: Elon Musk is considering that Tesla could have better audio quality with Apple's AirPlay, over the current Bluetooth.
articles.summary:
Elon Musk is considering that Tesla could have better audio quality with Apple's AirPlay. Over the current Bluetooth, the quality may not be up-to-the-mark. Over years Tesla has been working on improving the quality in the best possible ways.
Image credits- Electrek
The Model 3 sound system is said to be well received by audiophiles. Also, the new sound system version in Model S has some positive reviews. It was compared to Bang & Olufsen system, which is used in premium vehicles at an additional price.
authors: Currently Finishing My Master'S In Journalism

articles.title: Tesla Considering Adopting Apple's AirPlay to Improve Audio Quality
articles.author: info@hypebeast.com (HYPEBEAST)
articles.summary:
Elon Musk has said that Tesla will consider adopting Apple‘s AirPlay protocol to improve their audio quality control over the current Bluetooth system.
Over the past years, Tesla emphasized their passion for sound systems by ensuring its vehicles have the utmost sound quality. Their latest version of the Model S and Model 3 has received positive comments from audiophiles.
In the past, Tesla's audio system has always been compared to a Bang & Olufsen system, which is often found in premium vehicles, however, for a fraction of the price.

articles.title: Tesla is considering adopting Apple's Airplay to improve audio quality
articles.author: Fred Lambert
articles.excerpt: Elon Musk said that Tesla is going to consider adopting Apple's Airplay protocol to improve audio quality over the current Bluetooth. In recent years, Tesla has put an emphasis on the sound system…
articles.summary:
Elon Musk said that Tesla is going to consider adopting Apple's Airplay protocol to improve audio quality over the current Bluetooth. In recent years, Tesla has put an emphasis on the sound system inside its vehicles.
The sound system in the Model 3 has been well-received by audiophiles, and the one in the new version of the Model S has also received positive reviews.
It has been compared to an expensive Bang & Olufsen system often found in premium vehicles, but for a fraction of the price.
When a reviewer made the comparison on Twitter, Tesla CEO Elon Musk commented:

Tesla audio engineers come from B&O & many other companies.
authors: Get Interesting Investment Ideas Fred Lambert
Chargepoint Home Wifi Enabled Electric Vehicle

articles.title: Tesla to End Work From Home Privileges For Employees, Elon Musk Confirms
articles.author: Sophie Webster
articles.excerpt: Musk wrote in an email that employees who won't show up in the office would be fired. Two years after the COVID-19 pandemic, businesses are now discontinuing their employees' work-from-home…
articles.summary: Sophie Webster, Tech Times 01 June 2022, 10:06 am (Photo : GettyImages/ Dimitrios Kambouris) Elon Musk Two years after the COVID-19 pandemic, businesses are now discontinuing their employees' work-from-home privileges. The latest company to announce that it is ending remote work is Tesla. The automaker's CEO Elon Musk reportedly sent an email to Tesla's executive staff with a subject line that says the company will no longer accept remote work. Tesla to End Work From Home Privileges According to Bloomberg, Musk wants the automaker's employees to spend at least 40 hours per week in the office, or they could get fired.
articles.rights: All articles are copyrighted by Tech Times

articles.title: Tesla Could Adopt Apple AirPlay to Improve its Speaker Systems (Sorry, Still No CarPlay)
articles.excerpt: Elon Musk said he'd talk to Tesla's audio engineering team about switching from Bluetooth to Wi-Fi.
articles.summary: Tesla could one day bring Apple technology to the cabin of its electric cars. Before I go any further: CarPlay isn't coming to save you from using Tesla's operating system. Rather, the automaker is discussing ways of improving its already excellent sound system by using AirPlay instead of Bluetooth.Twitter user ShibaDoge proposed last week that Tesla use AirPlay for lossless audio streaming. Tesla CEO Elon Musk responded, stating that he'd discuss the idea (and other improvements) with Tesla's audio engineering team.

articles.title: Tesla's Elon Musk Hints Apple AirPlay, Lossless Music Support
articles.author: Teejay
articles.excerpt: Tesla's Elon Musk says Apple AirPlay and lossless music support will be discussed with the electric vehicle (EV) maker's audio team.
articles.summary: Tesla CEO Elon Musk says that his audio team will discuss Apple AirPlay and lossless quality music support, along with other auditory improvements. (Photo : Frederic J. Brown/Getty Images) Tesla CEO Elon Musk speaks during the unveiling of the new Tesla Model Y in Hawthorne, California on March 14, 2019. The founder of the electric-focused carmaker also took the opportunity to praise the sound system of both the Tesla Model S sedan and the Model X SUV. Elon Musk and Tesla The billionaire tech entrepreneur, Musk, has massive roles in his ambitious firms, such as SpaceX and Tesla, as both continue to bring disruptive innovations to consumers these days.

articles.title: Tesla Could Adopt Apple AirPlay to Improve its Speaker Systems (Sorry, Still No CarPlay)
articles.author: Phillip Tracy
articles.excerpt: Tesla could one day bring Apple technology to the cabin of its electric cars. Before I go any further: CarPlay...
articles.summary: Tesla (Photo: Robert Alexander, Getty Images) Tesla could one day bring Apple technology to the cabin of its electric cars. Before I go any further: CarPlay isn't coming to save you from using Tesla's operating system. Rather, the automaker is discussing ways of improving its already excellent sound system by using AirPlay instead of Bluetooth.Twitter user ShibaDoge proposed last week that Tesla use AirPlay for lossless audio streaming. Tesla CEO Elon Musk responded, stating that he'd discuss the idea (and other improvements) with Tesla's audio engineering team.
